page.title: Saddam Hussein and al-Qaeda link allegations

[[Image:Saddam Hussein on his throne.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Saddam Hussein with the [[Flag of Iraq#1991â2004|flag of Iraq]] he implemented during the [[Gulf War]]]]
 
'''Saddam Hussein and al-Qaeda link allegations''' were made by some [[Federal government of the United States|U.S. Government]] officials who claimed that a highly secretive relationship existed between former [[President of Iraq|Iraqi President]] [[Saddam Hussein]] and the radical [[Islamism|Islamist]] [[militant]] organization [[Al-Qaeda]] from 1992 to 2003, specifically through a series of meetings reportedly involving the [[Iraqi Intelligence Service]] (IIS).<ref name="caseclosed" /> In the lead up to the [[Iraq War]], [[President of the United States|U.S. President]] [[George W. Bush]] alleged that [[Iraq]]i [[President of Iraq|President]] [[Saddam Hussein]] and militant group [[al-Qaeda]] might conspire to launch terrorist attacks on the [[United States]],<ref>{{cite press release
